setting: Dido's palace, Ancient Carthage
range: D#/Eb4 to G5. Tessitura G4 to D#/Eb5
synopsis: Belinda tries to cheer up Dido, asking her to wipe the sad look from off of her face and think of all the good things she has

title: Ah Belinda!
subtitle: - No.2 from Act I of the English opera, Dido and Aeneas by Henry Purcell
setting: Dido's palace, Ancient Carthage
range: C4 to F5. Tessitura D4 to D#/Eb5
synopsis: Dido tells Belinda that she is tormented by something that she will not tell her.

title: Pursue thy conquest, love
subtitle: - No. 10 from Act I of the English opera, Dido and Aeneas by Henry Purcell
setting: Dido's palace, Ancient Carthage
range: E4 to F5. Tessitura G4 to E5
synopsis: Belinda sees that Dido has fallen in love with Aeneas and asks Love to continue on with its conquest.

title: Thanks to these lonesome vales
subtitle: - No. 18, Song and Chorus from Act II of the English opera, Dido and Aeneas by Henry Purcell
setting: A countryside near Dido's palace, Ancient Carthage
range: G#/Ab4 to G5. Tessitura A5 to F5
synopsis: Belinda sings of the surrounding countryside's beauty.

title: Oft she visits this lov'd moutain
subtitle: - No. 19 from Act II of the English opera, Dido and Aeneas by Henry Purcell
setting: A countryside near Dido's palace, Ancient Carthage
range: G4 to D5. Tessitura A5 to F5
synopsis: Dido's attendant sings of the legend of Diana, who turned a man who saw here bathing into a deer.

title: Haste, haste to town
subtitle: - No. 21, Song and Chorus from Act II of the English opera, Dido and Aeneas by Henry Purcell
setting: A countryside near Dido's palace, Ancient Carthage
range: D4 to G5. Tessitura D4 to F5
synopsis: It begins to rain and Belinda exclaims that everyone should get to shelter.

title: Come away, fellow sailors
subtitle: - No. 23, Song and Chorus from Act III of the English opera, Dido and Aeneas by Henry Purcell
setting: The Ancient Carthage docks
range: F4 to G5. Tessitura G4 to F5
synopsis: A sailor tells the rest of his sailor friends to come back to their ship.

title: Our next motion
subtitle: - No. 26 from Act III of the English opera, Dido and Aeneas by Henry Purcell
setting: The Ancient Carthage docks
range: F4 to G5. Tessitura F4 to F5
synopsis: The sorceress tells of her plans to sink Aeneas's ship.

title: Dido's Lament (When I am laid)
subtitle: - No. 31 from Act III of the English opera, Dido and Aeneas by Henry Purcell
setting: Dido's palace, Ancient Carthage
range: G4 to G5. Tessitura G4 to D5
synopsis: With Aeneas gone back to Rome and Dido dying of grief, Dido asks for Belinda to remember her when she is dead.

title: Ach ich liebte
subtitle: - No. 6 from Act I of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the seaside country house of Pasha Selim
range: F4 to D6. Tessitura A#/Bb5 to A6
synopsis: The Pasha finds Konstanze weeping and asks her why she is sad.  She responds with this aria, saying that she once was in love and happy, but now she has lost that joy because she is separated from her love and is now in complete misery.

title: Durch Zrtlichkeit und Schmeicheln
subtitle: - No. 8 from Act II of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the gardens of Pasha Selim's country home
range: E4 to E6. Tessitura A5 to F#/Gb5
synopsis: Osmin tries to order Blondchen to satisfy his every wish.  Blondchen responds vehemently, though, stating that she will not be ordered around.  The only ways she can be won over is by tenderness, flattery, and good humor and Osmin's bad attitude only  make her want him less.

title: Welcher Wechsel herrscht...Traurigkeit ward mir zum Loose
subtitle: - No. 10. Recitative and Aria from Act II of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the gardens of Pasha Selim's country house
range: F#/Gb4 to A#/Bb6. Tessitura G4 to G5
synopsis: In this recitative and aria, Konstanze sings mournfully of the depression and despair she is undergoing because of her separation with Belmonte.  She cannot even tell her pain to the winds because then others will know of it as well.

title: Martern aller Arten
subtitle: - No. 11 from Act II of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the gardens of Pasha Selim's country house
range: B4 to D6. Tessitura G4 to C6
synopsis: Selim demands that Konstanze love him or suffer torture.  Inspired by Blondchen, Konstanze declared that she will never be unfaithful even though it means that she suffer torture, misery, pain and even death.  If he releases his demands on her, though, heaven will forgive him.

title: Welche Wonne, welche Lust
subtitle: - No. 12 from Act II of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the gardens of Pash Selim's country house
range: D4 to A6. Tessitura G4 to G5
synopsis: After Pedrillo tells Blondchen two bits of good news, that Belmonte has arrived and been accepted by the Pasha as an potential employee, Blondchen sings of her bliss and joy and promises to tell Konstanze right away.

title: Hier soll ich dich denn sehen
subtitle: - No. 1 from Act I of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the seaside country estate of Pasha Selim
range: G3 to A5. Tessitura G3 to G4
synopsis: Having finally reached the place where his love, Konstanze, is being kept, Belmonte anticipates seeing her finally after all the suffering he has endured.

title: Ah viens dmon, esprit du mal
subtitle: - Cabaletta for Oh dans l'ombre, dans la mystre from Act I of the French opera, Jrusalem by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: a gallery that joins the private chapel of the Count of Toulouse to the rest of his palace, Toulouse, 1095
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Planning to have Gaston murdered to enable him to take his niece Hlne for himself, Roger confesses his joy in such a demonic occurence.

title: jour fatal,  crime
subtitle: from Act II, Scene 1 of the French opera, Jrusalem by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: a cave in the Ramlan mountains in Palestine near Jerusalem, 1099
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Roger believes that, in attempting to murder Gaston to gain his niece's love, he has actually murdered his own brother.  Torn with self-hatred, he has left France and gone to the Holy Land and lived as a hermit.  He sings of how he is unable to escape his brother's ghost which seems to follow him everywhere.

title: Quell'ivresse, bonheur suprme
subtitle: - Cabaletta from Act II, Scene 1 of the French opera, Jrusalem by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: a cave in the Ramlan mountains in Palestine near Jerusalem, 1099
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Hlne, overjoyed to find both the water her people need to survive in the desert and news of her beloved Gaston's location, sings her happiness.

title: Je veux encore entendre
subtitle: - Cavatina from Act II, Scene 2 of the French opera, Jrusalem by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: a room in the Emir's palace, Ramla, Palestine, 1099
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Gaston has been imprisoned by the Emir of Ramla.  As he waits to speak to the Emir, his thoughts drift to his beloved Hlne who he has not seen since being exiled from France four years earlier.

title: Mes plaintes mes plaintes sont vaines
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 1 of the French opera, Jrusalem by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: the gardens at the Emir's harem in Ramla, Palestine, 1099
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: The Christian Crusade led by the Count of Toulouse has reached the Ramlan walls.  Hlne has been captured by the Ramlans, though, and after the Emir of Ramla mentions to her that she will be killed if the Christians attempt to enter the city, she prays to God to gain her freedom.

title: Non, non votre rage
subtitle: - Rond-finale from Act III, Scene 1 of the French opera, Jrusalem by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: the gardens at the Emir's harem in Ramla, Palestine, 1099
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: The Christian Crusade led by the Count of Toulouse has reached the Ramlan walls.  Hlne has been captured by the Ramlans, though, as well as her love Gaston who was exiled from France for apparently attempting Hlne's father's life.  He has broken free of his guards though and comes to Hlne right as her father, whose army has broken through the walls of Ramla, also approaches.  After her father condemns her for consorting with his "assassin", she replies furiously of her love for Gaston and of his innocence.

title: mes amis, mes frres d'armes
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 2 of the French opera, Jrusalem by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: the main square of Ramla, Palestine, 1099
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Gaston has been recaptured by the Christian Crusade for apparently attempting the Count of Toulouse's life.  On his execution day, his name is declared dishonorable and the execution is prepared.  Gaston pleads with the judges for his innocence.

title: Son pochi fiori
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, L'Amico Fritz by Pietro Mascagni
setting: The dining room of Fritz's house, Alsace, late 19th century
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: As Suzel gives Fritz flowers as a present, she sings him a song about them.

title: Laceri, miseri, tanti bambini
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, L'Amico Fritz by Pietro Mascagni
setting: The dining room of Fritz's house, Alsace, late 19th century
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: After hearing Beppe's violin-playing outside, Fritz invites him in to perform for his guests.  Beppe comes in and sings to the audience a song complimenting Fritz's virtues.

title: O pallida, che un giorno mi guardasti
subtitle: from Act III of the Italian opera, L'Amico Fritz by Pietro Mascagni
setting: The dining room of Fritz's house, Alsace, late 19th century
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Fritz is upset because he realizes that he is in love with Suzel and she is to be married to another.  To comfort him, Beppe tells him about some of his problems with love.

title: O amore, o bella luce del core
subtitle: from Act III of the Italian opera, L'Amico Fritz by Pietro Mascagni
role: Fritz Kobus,  a weathly unmarried land-owner
setting: The dining room of Fritz's house, Alsace, late 19th century
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Beppe has just told Fritz of his problems in love in order to cheer him up.  However it does just the opposite and makes he realize that he has no hope of breaking free of a love that he cannot have.

title: Non mi resta che il pianto
subtitle: from Act III of the Italian opera, L'Amico Fritz by Pietro Mascagni
setting: The dining room of Fritz's house, Alsace, late 19th century
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: After Suzel is told by David, a rabbi, that her wedding is arranged to someone not of her choosing, she tells him of her great love for Fritz and no one else.

title: Come due tizzi accesi
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, L'Arlesiana by Francesco Cila
setting: the farmyard of Rosa Mamai's farm, the end of May, late 1800's, Italy
range: A3 to G4. Tessitura D#/Eb3 to D4
synopsis: Baldassarre tells a story to L'Innocente, the mentally impaired son of Rosa Mamai.  He describes a little goat that is attacked during the night by a wolf. Throughout the entire night, the goat defends itself but finally as the morning breaks, it succumbs to its injuries.

title: Era un giorno di festa
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, L'Arlesiana by Francesco Cila
role: Rosa Mamai,  mother of Federico and L'Innocente
setting: the farmyard of Rosa Mamai's farm, the end of May, late 1800's, Italy
range: B4 to F#/Gb5. Tessitura E4 to E5
synopsis: Vivetta and Rosa Mamai are talking about Federico and the girl from Arles that captured his heart.  Upset because she loves Federico, Vivetta asks Rosa Mamai how Federico and the girl met.  She responds, saying that he met her on a feast day and they fell in love at once.  Now he no longer pays any attention to his mother.

title: Vieni con me sui monti
subtitle: from Act II of the Italian opera, L'Arlesiana by Francesco Cila
setting: on the banks of Vacares pond in the region of Camargue, the end of May, late 1800's, Italy
range: D#/Eb3 to F#/Gb4. Tessitura E3 to D4
synopsis: Federico has run away from home after finding out that his beloved girl from Arles has betrayed him with the stable boy.  The whole farm is out looking for him and eventually Baldassarre and L'Innocente find him.  Baldassarre tries to convince him to come back to the farm and forget about the girl by working with him on the pastures in the high hills.

title: Lamento di Federico (E' la solita storia)
subtitle: from Act II of the Italian opera, L'Arlesiana by Francesco Cila
setting: on the banks of Vacares pond in the region of Camargue, the end of May, late 1800's, Italy
range: E3 to A5. Tessitura G3 to G4
synopsis: Federico has run away from home after finding out that his beloved girl from Arles has betrayed him with the stable boy.  He is found by Baldassarre and L'Innocente but the former leaves to tend the flocks and the latter falls asleep.  As L'Innocente falls asleep, he mentions a line from astory told earlier about a goat.  This sets off Federico and he despairs over his lost love.

title: Esser madre  un inferno
subtitle: from Act III of the Italian opera, L'Arlesiana by Francesco Cila
role: Rosa Mamai,  mother of Federico and L'Innocente
setting: the eve of Federico's and Vivetta's wedding on Rosa Mamai's farm, the end of May, late 1800's, Italy
range: D4 to G#/Ab5. Tessitura F#/Gb4 to F#/Gb5
synopsis: After losing his love to the stable hand, Federico consents to marry Vivetta.  However, the passion for the girl from Arles still burns inside him and he attacks the stable hand with a sledgehammer.  The two are separated but Rosa Mamai decides to offer a prayer to God that she can remain strong throughout the trials that her son has put upon her.

title: Quanto  bella, quanto  cara
subtitle: - Cavatina from Act I, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, L'Elisir d'Amore by Gaetano Donizetti
role: Nemorino,  a young peasant in love with Adina
setting: The lawn of Adina's farm in an Italian village, 19th century
range: E3 to G4. Tessitura G3 to F4
synopsis: Nemorino sings of his love for Adina.  He believes that, although he will always love her, nothing will ever come of it because she does not want him.  He wonders who can teach him what he needs to win her heart.

title: Della crudele Isotta
subtitle: - Cavatina from Act I, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, L'Elisir d'Amore by Gaetano Donizetti
role: Adina,  a rich young farm owner
setting: The lawn of Adina's farm in an Italian village, 19th century
range: D#/Eb4 to B6. Tessitura E4 to G#/Ab5
synopsis: Adina has found the story of Tristan and Isolda and gathers her farmfolk to tell it to them.  She tells them the story of how Tristan drank a love potion and caused Isolda fall in love with him.  She wishes that she could find a potion like that.

title: Come Paride vezzoso
subtitle: - Cavatina from Act I, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, L'Elisir d'Amore by Gaetano Donizetti
role: Belcore,  the Sergeant of the village garrison
setting: The lawn of Adina's farm in an Italian village, 19th century
range: A#/Bb3 to E4. Tessitura C3 to D4
synopsis: Belcore enters, salutes her, and presents her with a bouquet of flowers.  He then proceeds to propose to her.  Believing that she is responding favorably, he explains it by singing that it is no wonder, since he is a sergeant and women like a military man.

title: Si, ritrovarla io giuro
subtitle: from Act II, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, La Cenerentola by Gioacchino Rossini
role: Don Ramiro,  the prince of Salerno
setting: The palace of the Prince
range: D3 to C5. Tessitura G3 to G4
synopsis: Cenerentola has given Don Ramiro (who is in disguise as the Prince's squire) a bracelet and tells him that when he finds the match, then she will be his.  She then leaves.  Alidoro encourages Ramiro to go after her and indeed she does.  He declares that he will no longer be in disguise and sings that he will find her.  For, he is guided by love and once he finds her, she shall never leave him.  The bracelet she has given him glitters brightly, but the light in her eyes is far more bright.

title: Una volta c'era un re
subtitle: - Canzone from Act II, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, La Cenerentola by Gioacchino Rossini
setting: The mansion of Don Magnifico
range: C4 to D5. Tessitura D4 to D5
synopsis: Cenerentola has returned from the Prince's ball and is now back to her usual place tending the fire.  She sings of a king who looked everywhere for a wife and at last found it in a simple girl like herself.

title: Nacqui all'affanno, al pianto
subtitle: - rond with chorus from Act II, Scene 3 of the Italian opera, La Cenerentola by Gioacchino Rossini
setting: The throne room
range: G#/Ab3 to B6. Tessitura B4 to G5
synopsis: Now married to Prince Ramiro, Cenerentola asks her husband to act upon her vengeance - to grant her relatives pardon.  She then goes on to sing that her life has been transformed by love as quickly as lightning.  She continues, singing that she forgives all who wronged her before and wants only to embrace them.  No longer by the cinders will she sing her sad song!

title: Deh se piacer
subtitle: - No. 2 from Act I of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
role: Vitellia,  daughter of the former Emperor Vitellius
setting: Vitellia's rooms
range: B4 to B6. Tessitura F#/Gb4 to D5
synopsis: Vitellia is in love with the emporer Titus but is angry that he has chosen someone else to be his wife.  She is trying to persuade Sextus, who is infatuated with her, to kill Titus so she can gain the throne.  Before this aria, though, she gets word that Titus has called off his marriage.  After Sextus tells her he can't decide between killing his best friend Titus or creating a marriage between his love and his best friend, Vitellia tells him to stop complaining, for that is the only way she would ever love him.

title: Parto, parto
subtitle: - No. 8a from Act I of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
role: Sextus (Sesto),  Titus's friend who is in love with Vitellia
setting: The Imperial garden
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: After Servilia orders Sextus to kill Titus and set fire to Rome, Sextus meekly acquiesces and sings that he will do anything for her beauty and love.

title: Torna di Tito a lato
subtitle: - No. 11 from Act II of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
role: Annius (Annio),  Sextus's friend who is in love with Servilia
setting: The Imperial garden
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Sextus and Annius meet after Sextus has set fire to the city and tried to kill the Emporer.  Sextus believes he must leave the country, but Annius tries to persuade him that it was a mistake and that Titus will forgive all if Sextus returns and confesses.

title: Tu fosti tradito
subtitle: - No. 15 from Act II of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
role: Annius (Annio),  Sextus's friend who is in love with Servilia
setting: The Imperial garden
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Sextus has been sentenced to death for his part in setting the city on fire and attempting to murder the emperor.  In this aria, Annius begs Publius and Titus to let Sextus live for Annius and Servilia's sake, even though he does deserve to die.

title: Deh per questo istante
subtitle: - No. 17, Rondo from Act II of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
role: Sextus (Sesto),  Titus's friend who is in love with Vitellia
setting: The Imperial garden
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Before signing Sextus's death warrant, he questions him to find some reason that he can pardon him.  Sextus will not tell him the name of his accomplice, Vitellia, for the Emporer has agreed to marry her.  Instead, in this aria, Sextus reminds Titus of how Sextus used to love him and how it is torturing Sextus that he betrayed Titus at all.

title: S'altro che lagrime
subtitle: - No. 19 from Act II of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
role: Servilia,  Sesto's sister who is in love with Annius.
setting: a road to the Arena
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Servilia finds Vitellia crying.  She believes that she is weeping because Sextus will die and tells her in this aria that her pity for Sextus is useless for he will still die.  Unbeknownst to her though, Vitellia is crying because she is the one who caused his execution.

title: Del pi sublime soglio
subtitle: - No. 5 from Act I of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
setting: The Forum in Rome
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Titus has just announced that he will marry Servilia, Sextus's sister, because Rome will like her.  He sings that the real joy of being a ruler is being able to reward faithful subjects  like Servilia with favors, such as this marriage (which she doesn't want since she is in love with Annius).

title: Ah se fosse
subtitle: - No. 7 from Act I of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
setting: The Imperial Garden
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: After Servilia throws herself at Titus's feet, begging him to let her marry Annius, Titus relents and declares that if everyone in his court was so honest, being a ruler would be a lot easier.

title: Se all'impero
subtitle: - No. 18 from Act II of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
setting: The Imperial garden
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: After signing Sextus's death warrant and then tearing it up, Titus sings to himself of the heartbreak that this whole incident has caused himself.

title: Tardi s'avvede
subtitle: - No. 14 from Act II of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
role: Publius (Publio),  prefect of the Pretorian Guard
setting: the Imperial garden
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Titus cannot believe that Sextus could attempt his murder and set fire to the city.  He asks Publius about Sextus's loyalty and Publius responds with this aria, singing that a truly loyal person would not commit such a crime.

title: Non pi di fiori
subtitle: from Act II of the Italian opera, La Clemenza di Tito by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Pietro Metastasio ,  revised by Caterino  Mazzolà
role: Vitellia,  daughter of the former Emperor Vitellius
setting: The Imperial garden
range: G3 to A6. Tessitura Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Vitellia, daughter of the deposed Emperor Vitellius, is in love with Emperor Titus. He loves another, so she induces Sextus, friend of Emperor Titus who is in love with her, to murder the Emperor.  Sextus does not succeed, but is accused, and she realizes that she must confess before the Emperor  that she asked him to commit the crime, as Sextus is prepared to die for her if she does not.  She realizes that she must abandon her hopes for the throne and marriage to Titus by telling the truth.

title: Certain rate, dans une cuisine
subtitle: from Part II, scene 3 of the French opera, La Damnation de Faust by Hector Berlioz
setting: Auerbach's cellar, Leipzig
range: G2 to D4. Tessitura A3 to C4
synopsis: Urged on by his fellow students, Brander sings a song about a rat and its impending death.

title: Une puce gentile
subtitle: from Part II, scene 3 of the French opera, La Damnation de Faust by Hector Berlioz
setting: Auerbach's cellar, Leipzig
range: D3 to F4. Tessitura F3 to D4
synopsis: After Brander sings his "Song of the Rat", Mphistophls appears and sings a parody on the song about a king and the flea that lived on him.

title: Voici des roses
subtitle: from Part II, scene 4 of the French opera, La Damnation de Faust by Hector Berlioz
setting: The banks of the Elbe
range: C3 to E4. Tessitura E3 to B5
synopsis: As Faust sleeps on the banks, Mphistophls invvokes the spirits to dance around him.

title: Merci doux crpuscule
subtitle: from Part III of the French opera, La Damnation de Faust by Hector Berlioz
role: Faust,  an old man turned young by Mphistophls
setting: Marguerite's room
range: E3 to G#/Ab4. Tessitura G3 to F4
synopsis: Faust finds himself in Marguerite's room and revels at the joy of being in something so close to her.

title: Autrefois un roi de Thul
subtitle: from Part III of the French opera, La Damnation de Faust by Hector Berlioz
setting: Marguerite's room
range: C4 to F5. Tessitura D4 to D5
synopsis: As Marguerite gets ready to go to sleep, she sings a song about the King of Thule and his life.

title: Devant la maison
subtitle: - Serenade from Part III of the French opera, La Damnation de Faust by Hector Berlioz
setting: Marguerite's room
range: B3 to D#/Eb4. Tessitura D#/Eb3 to D#/Eb4
synopsis: Mphistophls serenades Marguerite and Faust mockingly about the deceit of man.

title: In voi belle  leggiadria
subtitle: - No. 20 from Act II of the Italian opera, La Finta Semplice by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
role: Fracasso,  a Hungarian captain staying with Cassandro
setting: At dinner in Cassandro's house near Cremona
range: F3 to G4. Tessitura F3 to F4
synopsis: Fracasso remarks that, while women are usually lazy, they will work endlessly for lover.

title: Vieni, vieni, o mia Ninetta
subtitle: - No. 22 from Act III of the Italian opera, La Finta Semplice by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: Cassandro's house near Cremona
range: G2 to F4. Tessitura C3 to C5
synopsis: Simone tells Ninetta that he is eager to be wedded to her and that they should stop being timid about it.

title: Sono in amore
subtitle: - No. 23 from Act III of the Italian opera, La Finta Semplice by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: Cassandro's house near Cremona
range: E4 to A6. Tessitura G4 to G5

title: Che scompiglio
subtitle: - No. 24 from Act III of the Italian opera, La Finta Semplice by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
role: Giacinta,  the somewhat aged sister of Polidoro and Cassandro
setting: Cassandro's house near Cremona
range: D#/Eb4 to D#/Eb5. Tessitura G4 to D5

title: Nelle guerre d'amore
subtitle: - No. 25 from Act III of the Italian opera, La Finta Semplice by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
role: Fracasso,  a Hungarian captain staying with Cassandro
setting: Cassandro's house near Cremona
range: D3 to G4. Tessitura E3 to E4
synopsis: Fracasso tells Giacinta that love is more often won with jealously than with valor.

subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, La Forza del Destino by Giuseppe Verdi

setting: Leonora's room in her father's house in Seville
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Leonora has been debating running away with her lover Don Alvaro.  Leonora's father is against Alvaro because of his mixed race.  She is tortued by her feelings toward her father, homeland and Don Alvaro.

subtitle: from Act II, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, La Forza del Destino by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Leonora,  the daughter of the Marquis of Calatrava
setting: A small flat space at the doors of the Church of Our Lady of Angels.
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Leonora has just arrived at the church disguised as a man.  After a close call at the inn with her brother, she gives thanks to God and calls upon the merciful Virgin to forgive her sins.

title: Pace, pace mio Dio!
subtitle: from Act IV, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, La Forza del Destino by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Leonora,  the daughter of the Marquis of Calatrava
setting: Outside the cave where Leonora has come to live out her remaining days in repentance.
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Leonora calls for peace from God on her tortued soul.  She still loves Alvaro after all these years and the bad things that have happened.  She calls upon God to end her suffering.  She is about to eat when she hears someone approaching

title: Al suon del tamburo
subtitle: from Act II, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, La Forza del Destino by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: The village of Hornachuelos
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Preziosilla has asked if anyone would like to have their fortune told and all respond - "Yes!  all of us!"  She launches into an aria in praise of the beauty of war.

title: La vita  inferno . . . O tu che in seno agli angeli
subtitle: from Act III of the Italian opera, La Forza del Destino by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: Italy, near the town of Velletri
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Don Alvaro, now known as Don Federico Herreros, Captain of the Spanish Grenadiers, is musing on his lost love - Leonora.  He decries the fate that befell his parents and denied his royal throne.  He has come here to fight in battle and h

title: Son Pereda son ricco d'onore
subtitle: from Act II, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, La Forza del Destino by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Don Carlo,  the son of the Marquis of Calatrava
setting: The village of Hornachuelos
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Don Carlo has been hinting at harrassing the newcomer, Leonora in disguise, when the Mayor tells him it would be better if he instead told them his story.  Carlo tells them he is Pereda, an honor student at Salamanca.  A foreigner murder

title: Morir!  Tremenda cosa! . . . Urna fatale del mio destino
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, La Forza del Destino by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Don Carlo,  the son of the Marquis of Calatrava
setting: A room near Velletri.  The battle is over and Don Alvaro is in surgery.
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Alvaro and Carlo each has concealed his true identity from the other.  Carlo has been taken wounded and is undergoing surgery.  Alvaro has been entrusted with Carlo's papers and is debating searching them for proof of his true identity. The Surgeon enters and tells him that Alvaro shall live.  Carlo proclaims great joy and imagines finding Carlo and Leonora together  and dispatching them both to hell with one blow from his sword.

title: O monumento!
subtitle: - Monologuo from Act I of the Italian opera, La Gioconda by Amilcare Ponchielli
libretto: Arrigo Boito ,  (under the pseudonym of Tobia Gorrio)
role: Barnaba,  a spy for the Inquisition
setting: Courtyard of the Duke's Palace, Venice, 17th century
range: D3 to G4. Tessitura F3 to D4
synopsis: Barnaba has arranged to meet with Enzo later on in order to bring Laura (the Duke's wife) to Enzo for a lover's meeting.  However, Barnaba plans to betray him and writes an anonymous letter to the Inquisition disclosing the time and location of the meeting, explaining each of his actions as he does them.

title: Voce di donna
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, La Gioconda by Amilcare Ponchielli
libretto: Arrigo Boito ,  (under the pseudonym of Tobia Gorrio)
role: La Cieca,  mother of La Gioconda
setting: Courtyard of the Duke's Palace, Venice, 17th century
range: A#/Bb4 to G5. Tessitura D4 to D#/Eb5
synopsis: After La Cieca is accused of witchcraft by Barnaba, the crowd begins to threaten the old woman's life.  She is saved in the nick of time by Laura and her husband Duke Alvise.  Grateful, La Cieca gives Laura a rosary along with her blessing.

title: Ah, pescator affonda l'esca
subtitle: - Barcarolle from Act II of the Italian opera, La Gioconda by Amilcare Ponchielli
libretto: Arrigo Boito ,  (under the pseudonym of Tobia Gorrio)
role: Barnaba,  a spy for the Inquisition
setting: The deck of Enzo's ship, 17th century
range: D#/Eb3 to F4. Tessitura F3 to D#/Eb4
synopsis: Barnaba sings a merry fisherman's ballad along with Enzo's crew.  However, his cheerfulness is merely a front in order to measure the strength of Enzo's men.

title: Cielo e mar!
subtitle: - Romanza from Act II of the Italian opera, La Gioconda by Amilcare Ponchielli
libretto: Arrigo Boito ,  (under the pseudonym of Tobia Gorrio)
setting: The deck of Enzo's ship, 17th century
range: D3 to A#/Bb5. Tessitura G3 to G4
synopsis: As Enzo stands watch on his ship, he awaits the arrival of his love Laura.  He sings of the sea and sky around him and his love.

title: Stella del marinar!
subtitle: - Romanza from Act II of the Italian opera, La Gioconda by Amilcare Ponchielli
libretto: Arrigo Boito ,  (under the pseudonym of Tobia Gorrio)
setting: The deck of Enzo's ship, the docks of Venice, 17th century
range: A#/Bb4 to A6. Tessitura A5 to F5
synopsis: After Enzo and Laura have planned their elopement, Enzo goes below-decks to ready himself.  Laura prays for protection from the forces that wish to keep the two lovers apart namely her husband Duke Alvise and Enzo's fiancee La Gioconda.

title: S, morir ella de'!
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, La Gioconda by Amilcare Ponchielli
libretto: Arrigo Boito ,  (under the pseudonym of Tobia Gorrio)
role: Duke Alvise Badoero,  a leader of the Inquisition
setting: A room in Alvise's palace, Venice, 17th century
range: G2 to F4. Tessitura C3 to D4
synopsis: Duke Alvise has found out that Laura has betrayed him.  He plans to have his revenge upon her during a party.

title: Suicidio!
subtitle: from Act IV of the Italian opera, La Gioconda by Amilcare Ponchielli
libretto: Arrigo Boito ,  (under the pseudonym of Tobia Gorrio)
setting: A room in a ruined palace on the Giudecca island, Venice, 17th century
range: C#/Db4 to B6. Tessitura F#/Gb4 to F#/Gb5
synopsis: La Gioconda's life is in shambles.  She is engaged to Enzo but he does not love her.  He instead loves Laura who La Gioconda has saved from her vindictive husband several times.  In order to save Enzo as well, La Gioconda has offered herself to the evil spy Barnaba.  In addition, her mother has disappeared. She now contemplates suicide, hoping that it will release her from some of the pain she feels.

title: Si la rigueur et la vengeance
subtitle: - No. 2, Cavatine from Act I of the French opera, La Juive by Jacques Franois Fromental Halvy
role: Cardinal de Brogni,  president of the Council
setting: a square in Constance, Switzerland, 1414
range: F2 to C4. Tessitura C3 to A#/Bb4
synopsis: Brogni and Elazar meet in the square after Elazar is brought before the provost of the town for working during a holiday in honor of the Emperor.  Elazar is upset because of the inequalities between the treatment of Christians and he and his daughter, who are Jewish.  Brogni then prays that the Jewish people will find enlightenment in the Christian faith.

title: Konstanze, Konstanze...O wie ngstlich
subtitle: - No. 4 from Act I of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the seaside country estate of Pasha Selim
range: F#/Gb3 to A5. Tessitura G#/Ab3 to F#/Gb4
synopsis: In this recitative and aria, Belmonte sings of the almost painful anticipation he experiences now that he is so close to seeing Konstanze again.

title: Frisch zum Kampfe
subtitle: - No. 13 from Act II of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the gardens of Pasha Selim's country house
range: D3 to B5. Tessitura F#/Gb3 to A5
synopsis: Pedrillo realizes that the only way that they will all get free of the Pasha is if he himself becomes bold.  With this aria, he declares that he shall not be cowardly but, rather, shall be daring

title: Wenn der Freude Trnen fliessen
subtitle: - No. 15 from Act II of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the gardens of Pasha Selim's country house
range: C3 to G#/Ab4. Tessitura A4 to G4
synopsis: Konstanze and Belmonte are finally reunited and as she falls weeping against his chest, he sings that tears of joy are one of the greatest things a lover can receive.  He tells her that to see her again is worth more than all of Croesus's riches and that he would never have realized it if they had not seen each other again.

title: Ich baue ganz auf deine Strke
subtitle: - No. 17 from Act III, Scene I of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the palace square
range: D#/Eb3 to A#/Bb5. Tessitura G3 to G4
synopsis: As Belmonte and Pedrillo plan to steal their women back from the Pasha, Belmonte sings that love has been and continues to be all his strength and that he will rely on its power.

title: In Mohrenland gefangen war ein Mdel
subtitle: - No. 18 from Act III, Scene I of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
setting: the palace square
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Pedrillo sings this song to signal the ladies to get ready to leave.  It describes a girl who is caught by the Moors and how a knight came to rescue her.

title: Wer ein Liebchen hat gefunden
subtitle: - No. 2, Lied from Act I of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
role: Osmin,  custodian of the Pasha's country house
setting: the seaside country estate of Pasha Selim
range: G2 to D4. Tessitura D3 to D4
synopsis: Osmin sings a song while picking figs, not realizing that Belmonte is watching.  His song advises the listener to reward your love with kisses and make her life great.  It also advises the young lover to lock up  your woman's other lovers, lest they tempt her to forget her faithfulness.

title: Solche hergelaufne Laffen
subtitle: - No. 3 from Act I of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
role: Osmin,  custodian of the Pasha's country house
setting: the seaside country estate of Pasha Selim
range: F2 to F4. Tessitura F2 to D4
synopsis: In this aria, Osmin explains, in graphic manner, why he does not like Pedrillo.  It turns out that it is mainly because Osmin and Pedrillo are both in love with Blondchen and Pedrillo is in better favor with both Blondchen and the Pasha.

title: O wie will ich triumphieren
subtitle: - No. 19 from Act I, Scene I of the German opera, Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
libretto: Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ,  revised by Gottlieb Stephanie, Jr.
role: Osmin,  custodian of the Pasha's country house
setting: the seaside country estate of Pasha Selim
range: D2 to D4. Tessitura D3 to D4
synopsis: After Pedrillo, Belmonte, Blondchen, and Konstanze are captured trying to escape, Osmin sings of the delight that he will have when they are all hanged.

title: Wo find ich Dich
subtitle: from Act I, Scene 2 of the German opera, Die Feen by Richard Wagner
setting: a rocky wilderness
range: F3 to G#/Ab4. Tessitura A#/Bb4 to G#/Ab4
synopsis: Eight years ago, Arindal and his friend Gernot were on a hunting trip when they were magically transported to a fairy kingdom where Arindal fell in love with a woman named Ada and married her.  The only condition on the marriage is that he never ask his wife about her past.  He kept the promise for years but finally curiosity overtook him and he asked her who she was and she disappeared in a flash of smoke.  Arindal and Gernot were transported to rocky wilderness.  Full of longing, Arindal now cries Ada's name out to the wilderness, wondering where he might find her.

title: War einst 'ne bse Hexe wol
subtitle: - Romanze from Act I, Scene 2 of the German opera, Die Feen by Richard Wagner
setting: a rocky wilderness
range: B3 to D#/Eb4. Tessitura E3 to D4
synopsis: Arindal is depressed because his wife has disappeared in a puff of smoke and he does not know where to find her.  To cheer him up, Gernot tells a story about an evil witch who was old and ugly, but wore a magic ring to appear young and beautiful.  She entranced a king and he married her.  When he later found her in bed with another, he drew his dagger and attacked her but only cut off the finger that held the ring.  The witch's true form was revealed to all.

title: Wie muss ich doch beklagen
subtitle: - Cavatina from Act I, Scene 3 of the German opera, Die Feen by Richard Wagner
setting: a fairy garden in front of a palace
range: E4 to G#/Ab5. Tessitura G4 to G5
synopsis: Ada watches over the sleeping form of her beloved, Arindal, who is mortal.  She knows that they cannot be together as long as one is immortal and the other is not.  Ada loves her fairy realm but contemplates becoming mortal and giving it all up just to be with him.

title: O musst du Hoffnung schwinden
subtitle: from Act II of the German opera, Die Feen by Richard Wagner
setting: the entrance hall of the palace in the capital of Arindal's kingdom
range: C#/Db4 to C6. Tessitura G4 to A6
synopsis: The kingdom of Tramond is being attacked by a neighboring kingdom whose king wants to claim Lora as his bride.  The old king has died and Arindal is missing so the entire population of the kingdom is convinced that they are doomed.  Lora, however, encourages the warriors that hope is still alive that Arindal will be found.  Although she presents a brave front, she herself is also full of doubt.  She wonders if even this hope will be extinguished and she will have no one at all.

title: Weh' mir, so nah' die frchterliche StundeIch hufe selbst die Schrecken an
subtitle: from Act II of the German opera, Die Feen by Richard Wagner
setting: the entrance hall of the palace in the capital of Arindal's kingdom
range: C#/Db4 to B6. Tessitura F#/Gb4 to A6
synopsis: The hour is growing closer when Ada must make the decision to either abandon her beloved mortal Arindal or become mortal herself.  She realizes that even if she becomes mortal, it is no assurance of happiness since the kingdom is under attack and Arindal is angry with her.  She is upset at herself for driving him away.  Finally, she decides that her love for him is too strong to throw away.  She will try her best to maintain their love and give up all she has.

title: Ich seh' den Himmel
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 1 of the German opera, Die Feen by Richard Wagner
setting: a decorated hall in the palace in the capital of Arindal's kingdom
range: F3 to G#/Ab4. Tessitura G3 to G4
synopsis: Arindal appears in a hall decorated to celebrate the victory of his kingdom's forces over an invading kingdom.  However, he has gone mad because his wife has told him that she is immortal and that she will be turned into stone because he has rejected her.  He sees hallucinations of heaven and himself flying to the gods.  He suddenly becomes exhausted and lays down to sleep, imagining that he is resting in Ada's arms.

title: O ihr, des Busens Hochgefhle
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 2 of the German opera, Die Feen by Richard Wagner
setting: A cavern filled with hideous spirits
range: G3 to A5. Tessitura A4 to G4
synopsis: In an attempt to rescue his wife from a curse that has turned her into stone, Arindal descends into a fearsome cavern and fights his way through spirits to the statue of his wife.  He then takes up a lyre and sings to her of his deep love for her, asking the stone to release Ada from its grasp.

title: Da schreibt meine Schwester
subtitle: - No. 1, part of Introduction from Act I of the German opera, Die Fledermaus by Johann Strauss
setting: An empty room in the residence of Gabriel von Eisenstein, Vienna, Austria, 1870.
range: C4 to B6. Tessitura F#/Gb4 to F#/Gb5
synopsis: Adele is reading a letter from her sister who is in a ballet company.  Apparently the company has been invited to a party that night and Adele's sister would like her to come to it.

title: Trinke, Liebchen, trinke schnell
subtitle: - No. 5a, Drinking Song from Act I of the German opera, Die Fledermaus by Johann Strauss
setting: An empty room in the residence of Gabriel von Eisenstein, Vienna, Austria, 1870.
range: F#/Gb3 to A5. Tessitura A4 to G4
synopsis: Alfred, who has made plans for a meeting with his former love Rosalinda, arrives to the rendezvous somewhat drunk.  He encourages Rosalina to drink with him, for drinking makes life more merry.

title: Mein Herr, was dchten Sie von mir
subtitle: - No. 5b, Couplets from Act I of the German opera, Die Fledermaus by Johann Strauss
setting: An empty room in the residence of Gabriel von Eisenstein, Vienna, Austria, 1870.
range: D4 to G5. Tessitura F#/Gb4 to E5
synopsis: Frank the Jailer has come to take Rosalinda's husband Gabriel von Eisenstein away to jail for an eight-day sentence in jail.  In order to save him from going to jail, Rosalinda tells Frank that the man with her (Alfred) is actually Gabriel von Eisenstein.

title: Ich lade gern mir Gste ein
subtitle: - No. 7, Couplets from Act II of the German opera, Die Fledermaus by Johann Strauss
setting: A party in Prince Orlofsky's house, Vienna, Austria, 1870.
range: C4 to G#/Ab5. Tessitura D#/Eb4 to D#/Eb5
synopsis: Prince Orlofsky is enjoying the party he has thrown and tells everyone that they must enjoy the party in their own way.

title: Mein Herr Marquis, ein Mann wie Sie
subtitle: - No. 8, Couplets from Act II of the German opera, Die Fledermaus by Johann Strauss
setting: A party in Prince Orlofsky's house, Vienna, Austria, 1870.
range: D4 to D6. Tessitura D4 to G5
synopsis: Adele has run into her mistress's husband, Gabriel von Eisenstein.  He believes that he recognizes her but she convinces him that a chambermaid would never be found at a party such as this one.

title: Come notte a sol fulgente
subtitle: - Cabaletta for D'Egitto la su i lidi from Part I : Jerusalem of the Italian opera, Nabucco by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Zaccaria,  the High Priest of the Hebrews
setting: the Temple of Solomon, ancient Jerusalem
range: D3 to F#/Gb4. Tessitura D3 to D4
synopsis: The Assyrian army led by Nabucco has defeated the army of the Hebrews and is now poised to enter the city and defeat the Israelites once and for all.  The Hebrews are scared of what is to come and begin to pray for deliverance.  Zaccaria comes along, though, and revives their hope by telling them that Nabucco's daughter is their prisoner.  Besides, he goes on to sing, didn't the Lord bring them out of Egypt safely?  Likewise, God will defeat this army with the same power and might.

title: Dio di Giuda
subtitle: from Part IV : The Broken Idol, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Nabucco by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: a room in Nabucco's palace, ancient Babylon
range: E3 to F4. Tessitura F3 to E4
synopsis: Nabucco has not regained full sanity from when he was struck down by some fit (or Jehovah) in Part II.  The only thing left that he can think that might save him is to pray to Jehovah for forgiveness and strength.  The prayer does not go unanswered and Nabucco soon regains his full strength and sanity.

title: D'Egitto l su i lidi
subtitle: - Cavatina from Part I : Jerusalem of the Italian opera, Nabucco by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Zaccaria,  the High Priest of the Hebrews
setting: the Temple of Solomon, ancient Jerusalem
range: G2 to F4. Tessitura E3 to E4
synopsis: The Assyrian army led by Nabucco has defeated the army of the Hebrews and is now poised to enter the city and defeat the Israelites once and for all.  The Hebrews are scared of what is to come and begin to pray for deliverance.  Zaccaria comes along, though, and revives their hope by telling them that Nabucco's daughter is their prisoner.  Besides, he goes on to sing, didn't the Lord bring them out of Egypt safely?  Likewise, God will defeat this army with the same power and might.

title: Tu sul labbro
subtitle: - Preghiera from Part II : L'empio, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Nabucco by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Zaccaria,  the High Priest of the Hebrews
setting: a hall in Nabucco's palace, ancient Babylon
range: G2 to E4. Tessitura D3 to D4
synopsis: This prayer is to the god of the Hebrews, Jehovah.  In it, Zaccaria asks Jehovah to help those who do not accept the teachings of Jehovah (specifically, the Assyrians) to find their way to Jehovah so that the whole world will hear praise for the god of the Israelites.

title: Salgo gi del trono aurato
subtitle: - Cabaletta for Anch'io dischiuso un giorno from Part II : L'empio, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Nabucco by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: the royal chambers in ancient Babylon
range: B4 to C6. Tessitura G4 to A6
synopsis: The High Priest of Baal comes into the royal chambers and tells her that Abigaille's sister Fenema wants to free the Hebrews.  The priests of Baal have therefore set up a rumor that Nabucco has died, leaving Abigaille the throne.  Abigaille then responds, singing that she has decided that she will indeed take the throne by whatever means necessary.

title: O prodi miei, seguitemi
subtitle: - Cabaletta with chorus for Dio di Giuda from Part IV : The Broken Idol, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Nabucco by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: a room in Nabucco's palace, ancient Babylon
range: D#/Eb3 to G4. Tessitura G#/Ab3 to F4
synopsis: Nabucco has just regained his sanity from an attack by the gods. Nabucco's guards enter and are overjoyed when they find him back to normal.  They tell him about Abigaille sentencing Fenema to death.  Nabucco, worried, then sings that there is no time to lose for Fenema must be saved from Abigaille's treachery.

title: Casta Diva...Fine al rito
subtitle: - No. 4, Cavatina and Cabaletta from Act I of the Italian opera, Norma by Vincenzo Bellini
role: Norma,  High Priestess of the Druid Temple of Esus
setting: Night in the Druid's sacred forest, Gaul, around 50 B.C.
range: F4 to C6. Tessitura G4 to B6
synopsis: The Druids have come to meet with Norma, their high priestess.  They want to revolt against their Roman oppressors but Norma convinces them that their time to rise up has not come yet.  Rome will be defeated by their own failings.  Norma then invokes the moon and prays for peace.  While the chorus of Druids sings their derison against the Romans, Norma sings her cabaletta, privately worrying that that the hatred for the Romans must also translate to hatred for Pollione, her secret Roman lover.

title: Meco all' altar di Venere
subtitle: - No. 2, Cavatina and Cabaletta from Act I of the Italian opera, Norma by Vincenzo Bellini
setting: Night in the Druid's sacred forest, Gaul, around 50 B.C.
range: D3 to C5. Tessitura G3 to G4
synopsis: Pollione tells his friend Flavio that Norma has violated her vows by having his two children.  He goes on to say that he is now in love with Adalgisa, a holy virgin in the temple.  He has dreamed about taking Adalgisa to Rome, but it is bothering his conscience.  In his dream, Norma has gotten his revenge upon him.

title: Sgombra  la sacra selva...Deh!  proteggimi, o Dio!
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, Norma by Vincenzo Bellini
role: Adalgisa,  a virgin of the Durid temple
setting: Night in the Druid's sacred forest, Gaul, around 50 B.C.
range: A#/Bb4 to F#/Gb5. Tessitura Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Adalgisa, a young priestess of Irminsul, goes into the sacred wood to meet Pollione, the Roman Proconsol.  She prays to her god to protect her from her love.

title: Sotto il paterno tetto...Oh potessi nel mio core
subtitle: from Act I, Scene I of the Italian opera, Oberto Conte di San Bonifacio by Giuseppe Verdi
libretto: Antonio Piazza ,  attributed in score to Temistocle Solera
setting: the countryside with the castle of Ezzelino da Ramano in the background
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Before the aria, Leonora summarizes her story in both regular and arioso recitative.  It turns out that while her father was out at war with both Ezzelino da Ramano and the Count of Salinguerra, she stayed at home in her father's castle.  Under a false name, Riccardo, the Count of Salinguerra, met her and eventually seduced her by promising to marry her.  Of course, he didn't marry her and instead betrayed her.  In the andante of the aria she sings about the "angel of beauty" and her love for him that he betrayed.  The same theme continues in the cabaletta

title: Parmi che al fin quest' anima...Da tanta gioia assorta
subtitle: from Act I, Scene II of the Italian opera, Oberto Conte di San Bonifacio by Giuseppe Verdi
libretto: Antonio Piazza ,  attributed in score to Temistocle Solera
role: Cuniza,  sister of Ezzelino da Ramano
setting: a hall in the Castle of Ezzelino da Ramano
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: This cavatina was added later after the original production in a revival of

title: Oh, chi torna l'ardente pensiero?...Pi che i vezzi e lo splendore
subtitle: from Act II, Scene I of the Italian opera, Oberto Conte di San Bonifacio by Giuseppe Verdi

range: A#/Bb4 to C6. Tessitura G4 to A#/Bb6
synopsis: After being overrun by the Huns, the surviving Aquileians are rounded up and brought before Attila.  After Attila questions why some women have been spared against his orders, he is told that the Aquileian women fight beside their men and thus had been spared.  Odabella steps out to speak valiantly to Attila and he is so impressed that he gives her one request.  She asks for a sword and, upon receiving Attila's sword, she sings of how she will return divine justice upon the Huns and their king for oppressing her country.

title: Cara patria gi madre e reina
subtitle: - Cabaletta for Ella in poter del barbaro from Prologue, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Attila by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: A camp in the lagoons of the Adriatic Sea at dawn, 5th century
range: E3 to A5. Tessitura G3 to A5
synopsis: After being defeated by the Huns, Foresto is hailed as the leader of his people.  He is saddened because his love Odabella has been captured by the Huns, but his people inspire him to sing this cabaletta proclaiming that, although Rome has been defeated this time, it will rise once more like a phoenix from ashes.

title: Oltre quel limite, t'attendo, o spettro
subtitle: - Cabaletta for Mentre gonfiarsi l'anima from Act I, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Attila by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: Attila's camp, 5th century
range: C3 to F4. Tessitura E3 to D4
synopsis: After awakening from his sleep because a dream that the Romans will defeat his army, Attila discounts the dream, becoming angry and ordering all his men to prepare for battle against the remainders of the Aquileian troops at once.

title: Ritorna vincitor!
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, Ada by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Ada,  daughter of the King of Ethiopia
setting: A hall in the Palace of the Kings at Memphis.
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Radams, whom Aida is in love with, has just been given a rousing send-off to engage the Ethiopians in battle.   Aida is torn between her home-land, family and the man she loves - Radams'.

title: O Patria Mia
subtitle: from Act III of the Italian opera, Ada by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Ada,  daughter of the King of Ethiopia
setting: The banks of the Nile
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: It is the eve of Amneris' wedding to Radams and Aida has come to the banks of the nile near the temple to meet Radams.  She mourns her homeland which she will never see again.

title: Celeste Aida
subtitle: - Romanza from Act I of the Italian opera, Ada by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Radams,  an officer in the Egyptian army
setting: A hall in the Palace of the Kings at Memphis.
range: Has not been entered yet.
synopsis: Rumors of an impending war with Ethiopia have been circulating.  Radams has just been told by Ramfis that Isis has named a new, young man to command the Egyptian Army.  Radams wishes it were he so he could free Aida.

title: Ah, dov'?
subtitle: - No. 6 from Act I, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Semiramide by Gioacchino Rossini
setting: the Temple of Baal, ancient Babylon
range: C3 to D5. Tessitura A4 to A5
synopsis: Idreno hopes that soon his strife and yearning will be appeased by the love of Princess Azema.  However, he is a little upset at the devious Prince Assur, who is trying to win the love of the princess as well.

title: Bel raggio lusinghier
subtitle: - No. 7, Cavatina with Chorus from Act I, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Semiramide by Gioacchino Rossini
setting: the Temple of Baal, ancient Babylon
range: C#/Db4 to A6. Tessitura E4 to F#/Gb5
synopsis: Semiramide expresses her great joy that her general Arsace has returned to her side.  She is in love with him, although she does not realize that he is actually her son.

title: In s barbara sciagura
subtitle: - No. 13, Aria with Chorus from Act II, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Semiramide by Gioacchino Rossini
role: Arsace,  the commander of the Assyrian army and unknowing son of Semiramide
setting: the royal palace in ancient Babylon
range: G3 to G5. Tessitura D4 to D#/Eb5
synopsis: The High Priest Oroe tells Arsace that he is actually the son of the late King and Semiramide and, therefore, the heir to the throne of Babylon.  He also informs Arsace that Semiramide and Prince Assur killed the King in order to bring Assur to power.  Arsace is both furious and sorrowful at this news.  He laments the death of his father and then swears vengeance upon his murderers.

title: La speranza pi soave
subtitle: - No. 14, Aria with Chorus from Act II, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Semiramide by Gioacchino Rossini
setting: the royal palace in ancient Babylon
range: A3 to C5. Tessitura F#/Gb3 to A5
synopsis: Although they are already engaged to be married, Princess Azema has just told Idreno that she wants to marry him.  He rejoices at his good fortune, although he still admits to a little jealousy because other men are also in love with her.

title: Deh! ti ferma ti placa
subtitle: - No. 16 from Act II, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Semiramide by Gioacchino Rossini
setting: the tomb of King Nino, ancient Babylon
range: G2 to F4. Tessitura D3 to D4
synopsis: After hearing that his crime of murdering the King has been revealed to the Babylonians, Assur is very upset and swears to kill Arsace.  He realizes, though, that he is in big trouble and calls out to God for mercy.  He once again regains his composure and swears to overcome his enemies.

title: Al mio pregar
subtitle: - No. 18, Preghiera from Act II, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Semiramide by Gioacchino Rossini
setting: the tomb of King Nino, ancient Babylon
range: D#/Eb4 to F5. Tessitura F4 to D#/Eb5
synopsis: After finding out that Arsace is her son, Semiramide worries that he will be killed by Assur, who helped her kill Arsace's father, the King.  Arsace and Semiramide have made peace with each other, but Assur and Arsace are bitter enemies.  She prays for Arsace's safety.

title: Ombra mai fu (Handel's Largo)
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, Serse by George Frideric Handel
setting: a garden in King Serse's palace, Persia
range: C4 to F5. Tessitura F4 to F5
synopsis: Serse sings to a tree, exclaiming its vast beauties.

title: Va godendo
subtitle: - Arietta from Act I of the Italian opera, Serse by George Frideric Handel
setting: a garden in King Serse's palace, Persia
range: F4 to A#/Bb6. Tessitura G4 to G5
synopsis: Romilda sings about the victims of love, comparing them to a little stream which loves its freedom.

title: Pi che penso
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, Serse by George Frideric Handel
setting: a garden in King Serse's palace, Persia
range: D4 to A6. Tessitura F4 to G5
synopsis: Serse has promised his general, Ariodate, that his daughter, Romilda, will marry a member of the royal family.  He assumes that it will be he that will marry Romilda and sings of his devotion and love to her.

title: Se bramate d'amar
subtitle: from Act II of the Italian opera, Serse by George Frideric Handel
setting: a square in the city, Persia
range: B4 to A6. Tessitura E4 to F#/Gb5
synopsis: An intercepted love letter from Arsamene to Romilda has made its way into Serse's hands.  He tells Romilda that the letter is actually going to Atalanta instead of her in hopes that she will give up her love for Arsamene and love him instead.  She still stands up for her love with some vehemance, however, and Serse attempts to shake off her strong emotions and not be affected by them.

title: Per rendermi beato
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Serse by George Frideric Handel
setting: the gallery of Serse's palace, Persia
range: D#/Eb4 to A6. Tessitura F#/Gb4 to F#/Gb5
synopsis: With Romilda angry at Arsamene, Serse manages to get her to commit to marry him instead of Arsamene.  He rejoices, sure of himself and of his own attractiveness.

title: Crude furie
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Serse by George Frideric Handel
setting: a large brightly lighted salon in Serse's palace, Persia
range: D4 to G5. Tessitura D4 to G5
synopsis: Serse was planning on marrying Romilda.  However, a misunderstanding by Romilda's father causes Romilda to marry her true love instead of Serse, who she doesn't really like that much.  He then finds that the princess Amastre sent a letter to Romilda's father which has helped to confuse the issue.   The interference in his plans arouses Serse's frustration which he explains throughly.

title: Als zullendes Kind
subtitle: from Act I, Scene 1 of the German opera, Siegfried by Richard Wagner
setting: a cave in a forest, Germany, mythical times
range: D#/Eb3 to F4. Tessitura F3 to C#/Db4
synopsis: Mime tells Siegfried that he feels very under-appreciated, even though Mime raised Siegfried from a child.  Now, Siegfried treats him very badly.

title: Nothung, Nothung!
subtitle: from Act I, Scene 3 of the German opera, Siegfried by Richard Wagner
role: Siegfried,  the son of Siegmund and Sieglinde
setting: a cave in a forest, Germany, mythical times
range: D3 to A5. Tessitura A4 to A5
synopsis: After Mime continues in his attempt to reforge the magic sword Nothung, Siegfried gives it a shot and as he forges, he sings.

title: Du bist nicht
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 1 of the German opera, Siegfried by Richard Wagner
role: Wanderer (Wotan),  the god Wotan disguised as a mortal
setting: the foot of a mountain, Germany, mythical times
range: A3 to F#/Gb4. Tessitura D3 to D4
synopsis: After Wotan talks to Erda, the earth goddess, who doesn't realize that he is Wotan, Erda falls asleep.  Wotan soliloquizes on the end of the world which is supposed to happen soon.  Finally he decides that he shouldn't worry about it that much.

title: Ewig war ich (Siegfried Idyll)
subtitle: from Act III, Scene 3 of the German opera, Siegfried by Richard Wagner
role: Brnnhilde,  a former Valkyrie who is now mortal
setting: the foot of a mountain, Germany, mythical times
range: E4 to C6. Tessitura D#/Eb4 to D#/Eb5
synopsis: After Siegfried wakes her from an eternal slumber, Brnnhilde tells him of her great love for him.

title: Il lacerato spirito
subtitle: - Romanza from Prologue of the Italian opera, Simon Boccanegra by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Jacopo Fiesco,  a noble of Genoa and grandfather of Amelia
setting: A square, Genoa, mid 14th century
range: F#/Gb2 to C#/Db4. Tessitura C#/Db3 to A#/Bb4
synopsis: Fiesco sings sorrowfully that his daughter Maria has died.  He rages against the absent Simon Boccanegra and then accuses the Virgin Mary of not protecting his daughter.  After realizing that he has committed blasphemy, he prays to her, hoping that she will forgive him.

title: Come in quest'ora bruna
subtitle: - Cavatina from Act I, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Simon Boccanegra by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Maria Boccanegra (Amelia),  Simon Boccanegra's illegitimate daughter
setting: the garden of the Grimaldi Palace, Genoa, mid 14th century.
range: C#/Db4 to A#/Bb6. Tessitura F4 to F5
synopsis: Amelia looks into the distance and remembers her childhood.  The sight of the moon and the sea together brings back the memory of an old woman who lived in a small hut by the sea who brought her up.  She promises never to let the extravagant surroundings of the palace make her forget her humble past.

title: Nell'ora soave
subtitle: - part of Finale from Act I, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Simon Boccanegra by Giuseppe Verdi
role: Maria Boccanegra (Amelia),  Simon Boccanegra's illegitimate daughter
setting: the chamber of the council in the palace of the Doge, Genoa, mid 14th century
range: D#/Eb4 to A#/Bb6. Tessitura F4 to F5
synopsis: Amelia tells a story of how she was captured and taken aboard a ship.  She fainted and when she awoke she was in a house.  She threatened her abductor, saying that she would expose him to the Doge.  He is frightened and lets her go but tells her that he was not the real abductor.

title: Plebe! Patrizi!
subtitle: - part of Finale from Act I, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Simon Boccanegra by Giuseppe Verdi
setting: the chamber of the council in the palace of the Doge, Genoa, mid 14th century
range: D#/Eb3 to F#/Gb4. Tessitura F#/Gb3 to D#/Eb4
synopsis: As people inside the council chamber draw arms against each other, Simon cries out for them to join in universal brotherhood.

title: Vedrai, carino
subtitle: - No. 18 from Act II, Scene I of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: The front of an inn
range: G4 to F5. Tessitura G4 to F5
synopsis: After Masetto has been beaten up by Don Giovanni (who is disguised as Leporello), Zerlina finds him and asks what happened.  He replies that Leporello beat him up and Zerlina promises to soothe his wounds with her love.

title: In quali...Mi tradi quell'alma ingrata
subtitle: - No. 21b, Recitative and Aria from Act II, Scene III of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
role: Donna Elvira,  a noblewoman seduced and abandoned by Don Giovanni
setting: A cemetary
range: D4 to A6. Tessitura A#/Bb5 to G#/Ab5
synopsis: Alone, Donna Elvira reflects on Don Giovanni, whose guilt she cannot deny even though she still feel affection towards him.

title: Troppo mi...Non mi dir
subtitle: - No. 23, Recitative and Aria from Act II, Scene V of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: A room in the palace of Donna Anna
range: E4 to A#/Bb6. Tessitura G4 to A6
synopsis: Donna Anna, who is still strongly affected by her father's death, asks that Don Ottavio cease talking about marriage until she has had time to get over this tragedy.  She still loves him, she says, but would like him to be patient.

title: Dalla sua pace
subtitle: - No. 10a from Act I, Scene IV of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: The countryside near the palace of Don Giovanni
range: D3 to G4. Tessitura G3 to G4
synopsis: After Donna Anna asks Don Ottavio, her fiance, to take revenge of Don Giovanni for killing her father, she leaves, at which point Don Ottavio express his love and worry for her.

title: Il mio tesoro
subtitle: - No. 21 from Act II, Scene II of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: A cemetary
range: D3 to A5. Tessitura F3 to G4
synopsis: Sure that Don Giovanni was the person who killed his fiancee's father, Don Ottavio swears that he will make sure Donna Anna gets her revenge on Don Giovanni.

title: Ho capito, signor, si
subtitle: - No. 6 from Act I, Scene III of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: The countryside
range: C3 to C4. Tessitura C3 to C4
synopsis: After Don Giovanni meets the wedding celebration of Masetto and Zerlina, he invites them to come to his house.  All of them, that is, except Zerlina.  Masetto knows he cannot oppose a nobleman, but he is worried about leaving Zerlina alone with Don Giovanni and capitulates to him sarcastically.

title: Fin ch'han dal vino
subtitle: - No. 11 from Act I, Scene V of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: The garden of the palace of Don Giovanni
range: D3 to E4. Tessitura F3 to D4
synopsis: As Don Giovanni arrives at his palace with the peasants awaiting the wedding party of Masetto and Zerlina inside, he declares that there shall be an incredible party with much wine and many women.

title: Deh, vieni alla finestra
subtitle: - No. 16, Canzonetta from Act II, Scene I of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: The front of an inn
range: D3 to E4. Tessitura F3 to D4
synopsis: After Leporello has led Donna Elvira away, Don Giovanni serenades her chambermaid.

title: Meta di voi qua vadano
subtitle: - No. 17 from Act II, Scene I of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: The front of an inn
range: C3 to E4. Tessitura F3 to D4
synopsis: Masetto and his peasant friends meet up with Don Giovanni, who is disguised as Leporello.  They are looking to capture Don Giovanni for seducing Zerlina.  He offers to help them find himself and suggests that he and Masetto should search in one group and the rest of the peasants should go off in another group.

title: Notte e giorno faticar
subtitle: - No. 1, part of Introduction from Act I, Scene I of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: A courtyard in the Commandatore's palace
range: A3 to C4. Tessitura A#/Bb3 to C4
synopsis: As the opera opens, Leporello complains that he always has to do the boring work.  While his master, Don Giovanni, gets to dally with beautiful women, Leporello just gets to stand outside and keep watch.

title: Madamina, il catalogo  questo
subtitle: - No. 4 from Act I, Scene II of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: A street at daybreak
range: A3 to E4. Tessitura D3 to D4
synopsis: After Donna Elvira confronts Don Giovanni, who had betrayed her, Leporello tells her that she should forget him, and then produces a book of the Don's feminine conquests 640 in Italy, 231 in Germany, 100 in France, 91 in Turkey, and 1003 in Spain.

title: Ah, pieta! Signori miei!
subtitle: - No. 20 from Act II, Scene II of the Italian opera, Don Giovanni by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
setting: A cemetary
range: A3 to E4. Tessitura D3 to D4
synopsis: After Donna Anna, Don Ottavio, and Masetto and his peasants find Leporello (who is disguised as Don Giovanni), they want to bring him to justice for all his wrong-doings.  Leporello then takes off the disguise and shows them that he is not, in fact, Don Giovanni.  When Masetto then accuses him of beating him up, Leporello explains to him that it couldn't have been him, since he was with Donna Elvira the entire time.

title: Bella siccome un angelo
subtitle: - No. 2, Romanza from Act I, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Don Pasquale by Gaetano Donizetti
role: Doctor Malatesta,  a friend of Ernesto and Don Pasquale
setting: a room in Don Pasquale's house, Rome, early 19th century
range: G#/Ab2 to F4. Tessitura C#/Db3 to C#/Db4
synopsis: For a long time, Don Pasquale has been looking for a young woman to marry.  He has asked his friend, Doctor Malatesta, to find a woman for him.  Malatesta describes the beautiful woman he has found, who he tells Pasquale is his sister.

title: Ah, un foco insolita
subtitle: - No. 3, Cavatina from Act I, Scene 1 of the Italian opera, Don Pasquale by Gaetano Donizetti
role: Don Pasquale, a  rich old bachelor
setting: a room in Don Pasquale's house, Rome, early 19th century
range: C3 to E4. Tessitura E3 to E4
synopsis: After Malatesta has told Don Pasquale that he has found a beautiful young wife for him, Don Pasquale sings of how this news makes him feel young again.  He can already imagine himself married to her with a half of a dozen children around him.

title: Quel guardo, il cavaliere...So anch'io la virt magica
subtitle: - No. 5, Cavatina from Act I, Scene 2 of the Italian opera, Don Pasquale by Gaetano Donizetti
setting: Norina's house, Rome, early 19th century
range: D4 to C#/Db6. Tessitura F4 to A6
synopsis: Norina is reading a novel about love.  After reading a passage aloud, she explains that she knows all the tricks of ensnaring a man.

title: Cercher lontana terra
subtitle: - No. 7 from Act II of the Italian opera, Don Pasquale by Gaetano Donizetti
setting: Don Pasquale's house, Rome, early 19th century
range: G#/Ab3 to A#/Bb5. Tessitura A#/Bb4 to A#/Bb5
synopsis: Ernesto knows that he will never be able to marry Norina now because he has been disinherited.  He decides to leave the town and is only content by knowing that Norina will be happy.

title: Com' gentil
subtitle: - No. 16, Serenata with chorus from Act III of the Italian opera, Don Pasquale by Gaetano Donizetti
setting: Don Pasquale's house, Rome, early 19th century
range: G#/Ab3 to A5. Tessitura A4 to A5
synopsis: Ernesto serenades Norina in Don Pasquale's garden, describing the beautiful night and his wishes to be with her.

title: La morale in tutto questo
subtitle: - No. 18, Rondo finale from Act III of the Italian opera, Don Pasquale by Gaetano Donizetti
setting: Don Pasquale's house, Rome, early 19th century
range: F4 to A#/Bb6. Tessitura F4 to G5
synopsis: Norina leads the chorus and the rest of the principals in stating the moral of the opera, which is "When you are old and you try to get remarried, fortune doesn't usually go your way."

title: O fior del giorno
subtitle: from Act I of the italian opera, Edgar by Giacomo Puccini
role: Fidelia,  a young woman in love with Edgar
setting: the main square of a Flemish village at dawn in April, late 19th century
range: D4 to B6. Tessitura G4 to G5
synopsis: Fidelia walks through the square of the village looking upon the flowers on the tree.  Their perfume brings hope to her.

title: Gi il mandorlo vicino
subtitle: from Act I of the Italian opera, Edgar by Giacomo Puccini
role: Fidelia,  a young woman in love with Edgar
setting: the main square of a Flemish village at dawn in April, late 19th century
range: C#/Db4 to A6. Tessitura G#/Ab4 to G5
synopsis: Edgar is asleep in front of an inn in the square.  Fidelia approaches him and wakes him.  Seeing that he is unhappy, she picks small branch off of an almond tree and gives it to him.  She tells him that she hopes it will make him feel better.
